english_translation: Narrated by Hisham ibn Ammar: Yahya ibn Hamzah narrated to us: Abd al-Aziz ibn Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz narrated to us, from Abdullah ibn Mawahib, from Qabisah ibn Dhuayb, from Tamim al-Dari (may Allah be pleased with him), he said: I asked: O Messenger of Allah, what is the Sunnah regarding a man from the people of disbelief who accepts Islam at the hands of a man and then dies? He said: He is more entitled to his life and his death

english_translation: Narrated by Duhayim: Abdullah ibn Yusuf narrated to us: al-Haytham ibn Humayd narrated to us: Zayd ibn Waqid narrated to me, from Sulayman ibn Musa, from Kathir ibn Murrah, from Tamim al-Dari (may Allah be pleased with him), from the Prophet ﷺ, he said: Whoever recites a hundred verses in a night is written among the standing (night prayer performers). Abu Bakr said: This is a sound isnad

english_translation: Narrated by Said ibn Ziyad ibn Fa'id ibn Abi Hind: Ziyad ibn Fa'id ibn Abi Hind, who is the cousin of Tamim al-Dari al-Lakhmi, narrated to us, from his father Fa'id ibn Ziyad, from his grandfather Ziyad ibn Abi Hind (may Allah be pleased with him), he said: We six people came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ: Tamim ibn Aus ibn Kharijah ibn Suwayd ibn Judhaimah ibn Dira' ibn Adi ibn al-Dar ibn Hani ibn Habib ibn Nimarah ibn Lakhm ibn Amr ibn Malik, and his brother Nuaym ibn Aus, and Yazid ibn Qays, and Abu Hind ibn Abdullah who narrated this hadith, and his brother al-Tayib ibn Abdullah whom the Messenger of Allah ﷺ named Abd al-Rahman, and Fakihah ibn al-Numan. We asked him to grant us land from the land of al-Sham, and he was in Makkah at that time. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Wherever you wish. We left from him consulting about a place to ask him for, and Tamim al-Dari (may Allah be pleased with him) said: Let me ask him for Bayt al-Maqdis and its surroundings. Abu Hind said: Have you seen the king of the foreigners who is in Bayt al-Maqdis? Tamim (may Allah be pleased with him) said: Yes. He said: Thus will be the house of the king of the Arabs in it, and I fear this will not be completed for us. Tamim said: Then let us ask for Bayt Jabrin and its surroundings. Abu Hind said: This is even greater and bigger. Tamim said: Where do you see fit? He said: The villages where their inhabitants place their dwellings in it along with traces of Ibrahim (peace be upon him). Tamim (may Allah be pleased with him) said: You are right. We went back to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and he said: O Tamim, if you wish inform me, or I will inform you of what you were discussing. Tamim (may Allah be pleased with him) said: Rather inform us, O Messenger of Allah, so that we may increase in faith. He said: You intended one thing and this one intended something else, and blessed is the one who saw. And he wrote for him a letter on a piece of leather from a piece of skin, then he entered with it into his house and worked in the corner of the document from below a seal and covered it with something unknown, and fastened with two cords from outside the document. And in the letter: In the name of Allah, the Most Merciful, this is what Muhammad, the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, granted to the Dari people: when Allah the Mighty and Majestic gives them the land, he has granted them Ein, Jabrun, and Bayt Ibrahim, we pass through them forever. Al-Abbas ibn Abd al-Muttalib, Jaham ibn Qays, and Shurahbil ibn Hasanah witnessed and wrote. He said: Then we came to him in al-Madinah and he renewed for us another letter: This is what Muhammad, the Messenger of Allah ﷺ gave to Tamim al-Dari: I have given them Ein and Bayt Jabrun, and the pasture of Bayt Ibrahim, a gift that remains for them and does not remain with them, and I fulfilled and handed that over to them forever and ever. Whoever harms them in it, Allah the Mighty and Majestic has harmed him. Abu Bakr ibn Abi Quhafahh, Umar ibn al-Khattab, Uthman ibn Affan, Ali ibn Abi Talib, and Muawiyah (may Allah be pleased with them all) witnessed, and he wrote.

english_translation: Narrated by Muhammad ibn Sinan: Muhammad ibn al-Muthanna narrated to us: Mutahhar ibn al-Haytham narrated to us, from Musa ibn Ali ibn Rabah, from his father, from his grandfather, he said: A child was born to me, so I came to the Prophet ﷺ and he said to me: Is a boy or a girl born to you? I said: A boy. He said: Whom does he resemble, his father or his mother? He said: Indeed, there is no drop except that it is present on every lineage between them and between Adam (peace be upon him)
